{{also|besëtzen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gem-pro|*bisatjaną|t=to set near; set around}}, equivalent to {{prefix|de|be|setzen}}. Cognate with {{cog|stq|besätte}}, {{cog|fy|besette}}, {{cog|nl|bezetten}}, {{cog|en|beset}}, {{cog|nds-de|besetten}}, {{cog|da|besætte}}, {{cog|sv|besätta}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-besetzen.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/bəˈzɛtsən/|[bəˈzɛtsn̩]}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|besetzt|besetzte|besetzt}} # {{lb|de|military|_|and general}} to [[occupy]] # {{lb|de|film|theatre}} to [[cast]] {{gloss|choose someone for a performing part}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|besetz|besetzt|h||t}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Besetzung}} * {{l|de|Besatzung}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Besatzer}} * {{l|de|Besatzungsmacht}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{affix|lb|be-|setzen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/beˈzætsen/|[bəˈzætsən]}} ===Verb=== {{lb-verb||besat}} # {{lb|lb|transitive}} to [[occupy]] # {{lb|lb|transitive|military}} to [[occupy]], to [[take]] # {{lb|lb|transitive|a seat or space}} to [[reserve]], to [[hold]] # {{lb|lb|transitive|a job or role}} to [[fill]] # {{lb|lb|transitive|film|theatre}} to [[cast]] ====Conjugation==== {{lb-conj-regular|besetz|besat|hunn}}
